Letter 26

November 21, 2019

üéâ Today is our newsletter‚Äôs first birthday! We sent out our first letter exactly a year ago‚Äîpretty cool. Thanks for being here with us.

This week, we knew we had to talk about Pokemon Sword and Shield, which is pretty much all either one of us has been thinking about for the past week. Remember when we had that long chat about Animal Crossing for Letter 16? This is another one of those. You‚Äôre welcome.


Ummm ok so to start us off

When we planned to do this, I wasn‚Äôt planning on buying the new Pokemon game

But then I did and I played it all weekend

Jillian

It be like that sometimes

Summer

BUT I still have lots and lots of questions for you!!! Because you‚Äôve been playing Pokemon for a long time and I‚Äôve pretty much never played a Pokemon game before

My first question for u: a few weeks ago, you tweeted ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think any starters should be available in different gens gjsodnsodnf‚Äù

What dis mean

Jillian

Thank you for that direct quote

So! Every pokemon game kind of has the same formula. You‚Äôre a 10 year old kid and that means you‚Äôre old enough to have a pokemon of your own! The inciting incident to getting your first pokemon varies, but you always receive it from the professor of the region. The professor will have three pokemon for you to choose from: a grass type, a water type, or a fire type. The majority of the time, the moment in which you choose is the unique incidence of any of those pokemon throughout the game. Your rival will also choose one of the three. These pokemon have pretty steady level growth, balanced stats, good moves, and are cute! You can‚Äôt catch them in the wild. You get them from the professor. They are SPECIAL.

Summer

Ohhhhh ok

Jillian

You form such a lovely bond with your starter! It‚Äôs your FIRST pokemon and they occur in EVERY generation. Like, yes we get it, everyone loves Charizard. I do too! So much! But it doesn‚Äôt need to be available all of the time. Use Scorbunny. There are other cool fire types in this generation. The nostalgia pull seems unnecessary and sort of takes away from the specialness of a starter if they are obtainable across generations.

Summer

Hmmmm does this tie into the drama about some Pokemon not being available in the new game or am I getting ahead of myself

Jillian

WE CAN GO THERE FOR SURE

Summer

Lmao we WILL go there

Jillian

How do you want to get into the drama?

Summer

I don‚Äôt really know much about the drama other than‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.there was some

Specifically with the release of Sword and Shield

Which is odd to me because it seems like such a great game that all my friends love, but I‚Äôm also viewing that from the perspective of someone who doesn‚Äôt really have any ties to the franchise

So I wanna hear about it from your perspective

Tell me about the drama babyyy!!!!!

Jillian

Basically, after you beat the elite four in the majority of pokemon games, you get a thing called a national dex that has spaces for EVERY POKEMON that exists rather than those exclusive to that region/game. SWSH doesn‚Äôt have a national dex and people are super upset! On the one hand, I get it, when the catchphrase is ‚Äúgotta catch em all.‚Äù However.

The deep, deep entitlement of gamers is soooo toxic. I‚Äôm not a big completionist type, but there‚Äôs still a pokedex to fill up. There are so many other lovely things to enjoy and we had so much to look forward to with this game‚Äîthe fact that people were so violently upset with this decision was really disheartening

Summer

Hmmm ok so you‚Äôre telling me I can‚Äôt get every pokemon that‚Äôs ever existed in this new game, but there‚Äôs still like‚Ä¶‚Ä¶a lot of pokemon in it anyway

Jillian

YES

I also think people are upset their specific favorites aren‚Äôt available, but it‚Äôs been like that across every game! You have to trade from weird places, across consoles even! (In the GBA era, to finish the national dex you had to hook up to the gamecube)

Summer

I kind of understand where people are coming from, especially if they have deep nostalgic ties to certain pokemon that they‚Äôve taken with them over many generations of the game, etc etc.

But also there are so many cuties and sweeties in this game! And it‚Äôs kind of exciting to see all the new ones!

Are there any specific pokemon that aren‚Äôt in this game that you miss?

Jillian

Honestly, no. I barely notice what isn‚Äôt available. I try to just use new pokemon on my team? Because I want to familiarize myself with the region. I‚Äôve been pleasantly surprised at what IS available, actually. I saw a video on Twitter of a Lucario in SWSH and freaked out because I LOVE LUCARIO

Summer

I do fully understand the instinct to distrust and critique big game studios, right? But I‚Äôm also really tired of the stereotypical toxic gamer who can‚Äôt just enjoy a cute, fun game without complaining about all of the reasons it isn‚Äôt exactly what they wanted!!! I‚Äôm not sure how to balance those two feelings

BUT I think we‚Äôve established that the game is good and fun and people should calm down and enjoy it

We‚Äôve both been playing it a lot since it came out so I can definitely endorse it as Good and Fun. Anyway.

Jillian

Absolutely! And I have some criticisms, but nothing that is keeping me from being so overjoyed that I have it.

Summer

I was kind of struggling with deciding which game to get, once I decided I wanted to play it. I went with Sword mostly because sword dog but also because you picked Shield. Why did you decide to get Shield?

Jillian

This is the most I‚Äôve ever struggled with picking a version, strangely enough.

Summer

Oooh why?

Jillian

I, too, love sword dog and was immediately enamored. But there were a few version exclusives that I was into‚Äîlike Galarian Ponyta and Goomy‚Äîbut mostly, it was because of my brother! We have, traditionally, always gotten opposing versions. And we‚Äôve never even had a problem deciding who got what‚Äîgenerally we were always drawn to different legendaries. But he really wanted Sword because of Sirfetch‚Äôd and it felt wrong to not continue our sibling tradition, even though we don‚Äôt live together.

Summer

Omg aw that‚Äôs very cute

Jillian

We did pick the same starter for the first time!!!!

Summer

Ok what was the first pokemon game you ever played

Jillian

So! I would play my brother‚Äôs copy of Pokemon Blue, but he wouldn‚Äôt let me restart it so I would just catch Rattatas and I didn‚Äôt know how to save so I would just turn the power off. That doesn‚Äôt super count, I guess, and maybe neither does Pokemon Stadium for N64, so Pokemon Ruby!!! 3rd gen.

Summer

Wow you go alllllll the way back huh

What‚Äôs your FAVORITE pokemon game

And least favorite?

Jillian

Oof. My nostalgia brain wants to say Pokemon Emerald, since it has some of the best post-game and I know that generation inside-out. I also love all three of those starters, even if I choose Torchic more often than not. I think XY is my least favorite‚Äîthe graphics were so cool and the pokemon were also great, but I thought the new mechanics made it too easy and I was really frustrated. There‚Äôs not a lot of post-game either.

Generally I feel like I will love a pokemon no matter what? So what makes a game for me is the story‚Äîand I think difficulty level is built into that.

Summer

Do you often replay pokemon games?

Or do you just keep playing one forever? Or do you let it end and wait for the next one?

Jillian

I‚Äôve played gen 1-4 over an EXCEPTIONAL amount of times, especially Gen 1 by way of FireRed. I clocked soooo many hours on Emerald specifically, even in the post-game‚Äînot super sure what I was doing, to be honest, but when you‚Äôre roughly 10 you have so much patience to do so many things. Replaying was great because there were so many new team combinations to explore!!!

Summer

This sort of touches on something that I was wondering, especially now that I‚Äôm in the trenches of a pokemon game, which is: do pokemon games‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.end?

Jillian

I guess it depends on how you define winning? You can beat the elite four, which technically makes you the champion, as many times as you want. Gens 3 and 4 had ‚Äúpokemon contests‚Äù, which were like beauty pageants in a few different categories; each pokemon can compete and get ribbons and stuff, etc etc.

Completing your pokedex is another definition people have

Theoretically, I can be happy with rechallenging the elite four over and over again, which is what I was doing in XY and Let‚Äôs Go. And in something like FireRed/LeafGreen, being the champion opens up a whole new set of areas to explore! So that‚Äôs not always the conclusion.

Summer

So you can pretty much keep going forever?

Jillian

Basically! Each game has different ways to make it interesting, but yeah. The final boss battle will always be open to you

Summer

nice, I like that

Do you think SW/SH is a good pokemon game for beginners? Or would you recommend starting somewhere different?

Jillian

I think it is, and I think it‚Äôs definitely designed to be easy to grasp as possible. Hop is a constant tutorial character, unfortunately.

Summer

He is‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.annoying

In a brotherly way I guess

Jillian

HE IS!!!!

Summer

Pls give me your tips for pokemon newbies like myself

Jillian

I strongly encourage having a balanced team and understanding typing as well as you can. I also recommend reading the pokedex online and familiarizing yourself with a region! I get people don‚Äôt like spoilers, but it‚Äôs really beneficial to learn what pokemon you want early on and where to find them, so there are no regrets. I get really attached to pokemon and am reluctant to make team adjustments, so knowing apple dragon, for example, existed was good!

Summer

Summer I am literally reading the pokedex RIGHT NOW because of you!!!!!

I think we both know how I feel about ‚Äúspoilers‚Äù in video games which is: look up as much stuff as you want, who cares, I just like to follow directions

I want to end this the same way we ended our conversation about animal crossing which is: tell me about your favorite pokemon memory!

Jillian

THIS IS SO HARD! Pokemon is my whole life. My first thought was playing Pokemon Go with my brother when it first came out, and our UTTER JOY at seeing a goddamn sandshrew on our driveway with the AR function. We were literally jumping in glee!!!! We are adults!!!! I used pokemon to make friends when I moved to California. My closest friends all gave me pokemon plushies as a present when I left Michigan. I got two Pikachu-based gifts when I graduated college. I have love tied to every aspect of the franchise: the games, the anime, etc.

I am so happy you have joined this journey

Summer
